snippet: Our reporters interview people all the time — sometimes over lunch, dinner or coffee. Often, though, the reference to what someone is consuming seems rote or pointless. This write-by-numbers effect is even worse if we use cliched descriptions like...
abstract: Our reporters interview people all the time — sometimes over lunch, dinner or coffee. Often, though, the reference to what someone is consuming seems rote or pointless. This write-by-numbers effect is even worse if we use cliched descriptions like “nibbled,” “munched” or “picked at.”
